text: <@U22PJPGK0> <@U6GNQ7JBU> <@U22PU4G4A> any insight into the above? My ideal solution would be to stop HS from including the tracking script automatically and include it myself from the template level in a locked HubL or HTML block
Sorry, I don’t think we have a way to do what you want. The tracking scripts a are always included automatically on every page.
HS devs found a small bug - the drag n drop zone text doesn’t have an english translation string apparently <https://spin.d.pr/FjtdM2+>
is there a way to use custom markup with a menu? For example I could call the menu and then loop through to display items with no HS markup?

if you find a way I’d love to hear it. could do some interesting things with that.

Otherwise no- not that I’m aware of, but the html they provide is perfect for most use-cases. has all the classes you need.

Only time I can see using different html is for mobile, and if you’re trying to bastardize the menu module so you get those controls but display something completely different than a menu.
That entire UI will be replaced soon.
are you guys planning to force people into design manager 2 or something? or maybe update DM1 page editors to use the new UI?
yeah, the editors will use the new File Picker

thanks Jon. 
yeah, sometimes we have menus that have other functionality in them such as preview of the pages, snippets of information, ads, etc (whatever the designers want to punish us with that project :slightly_smiling_face: ). 
we'll just have to either extract the menu and recreate it with JS, or hardcode it all together when the time comes. They can't tell us to build it in HS then have us do stuff HS won't let us. :slightly_smiling_face:

yea, there are a lot of methods for doing things like that, obviously it’d be ideal if you could control the structure for that. One kinda crappy way you could do it is using a hubDB instead of a menu, but I don’t recall if there’s a page link field.
I keep hearing great things about hubDB. hopefully I'll get into that soon.

re: `custom_form_html`
It allows you to add an html version of the form that will be rendered on html page output.
This custom html form will stay on the page only in the case javascript is disabled otherwise it gets immediately replaced by the forms embed javascript.
didn’t know that, interesting

So I just got word from support about the canonical issue:
>>>Any pages created prior January 8th of this year will have had the canonical URL set by default. Any pages created after January 8th will not have the default canonical URL set but will provide the option to add one.
interesting
Just as a heads up, that was published on the Product Updates blog that day: <https://www.HubSpot.com/product-updates/edit-the-canonical-url-of-a-page>
These seems very counter productive in my opinion. Is there a way to move this out of the advanced options area then?
If a page is created before the 8th then updated after the 8th, does it remove the default canonical then?
No, it does not remove it. It's just for new pages created after that date.
We're working on a portal-wide setting that you can configure for canonical URLs as well, but it's not rolled out quite yet.
I have some pages on a site that are showing no canonical for them (from a Moz Report) that were def created before the 8th of Jan (2018)
Can you DM me a list or screenshot and we can dig-in?
Anyone else getting cloudflare errors today? I am seeing it across devices and across portals
There was an issue earlier. What are you seeing now?

I was. It's calmed down for me now, but I got randomly kicked off a couple times with no way to log back in to <http://app.HubSpot.com|app.HubSpot.com>, sometimes the top toolbar would disappear, and I lost my autosave in the new design manager once or twice
Try setting your DNS to `8.8.8.8` in your network settings
A number of issues, actually, I can’t replicate them consistently. I haven’t seen it in a bit
The issue only lasted 3 minutes but could be longer on your side if your DNS server does aggressive caching, switching to google's DNS would fix that

Hey, I've been out for a while, wondering if HubSpot will be adding autocomplete="email"  and the such to the forms anytime, and how that would work if HubSpot already had the user data and was trying to autofill it
I did a few searches in slack and didn't see anyone asking so if you already discussed, sorry
Is anyone else having issues with the Error reporting in the new design manager, i get an error saying `Syntax error in "div"` this doesnt help me and there is nothing highlighted
fixed it somehow but i tried reverting to like 8 different places and it kept saying it till i reloaded the page
what are the general thoughts on the pending ADA compliance standards... seems like it would be nearly impossible to build a modern looking site that is fully compliant
for example having the h tags needing to follow a specific order seems absurd
<@U24GZQ3GF> I think the definition of "modern looking" will change at least for sites that are required to have AAA or anything like that.

agreed, and that's kind of a general term. i just notice almost every site i've tried the WAVE extension on fails with a lot of issues and i'm wondering how drastic the changes to web design will really be. guess we'll wait and see...
Just because the site uses h tags doesnt mean you cant change styling.
